page.title: 18Local Celebrity
page.content: It was during this time that Joe was on the dole, that he started writing. He wrote short stories for the local newspaper "The Miner".In 1928,1930 and 1932 he published slim volumes of poems.The General Strike and the six- months lock-out of the miners which followed, turned Joe's attention to play writing.His sketches and one act plays were written for Bowhill-players - a group of local miners and their wives who were raising money for the soup kitchens. After the strike, Joe wrote his first full length play "In Time o' Strife" who's theme concerned the miners recent sufferings.The play toured 25 mining villages and was spotted by Huge Ogilvie who persuaded them to do a profesional tour of Scottish music-hall theatres.At the end of the tour, the group disbanded (cont.)
